intro: Andicolea thuyoides, commonly known as the silverleaf hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States and parts of Mexico. It is characterized by its silver-gray, fuzzy leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for ornamental gardening. Its botanical features include opposite leaf arrangement and a woody stem structure. Andicolea thuyoides is part of the Malvaceae family, which includes other hibiscus species.
